headline.main: URUGUAY SCORES IN WORLD SOCCER; Crushes Scotland, 7-0, to Reach Quarter-Finals -- Austria Wins, 5 to 0

docs.snippet: GENEVA, June 19 -- The Credentials Committee of the International Labor Organization recommended today that the employer and worker members of the countries of the Soviet bloc be seated at the organization's conference now in session here.
docs.lead_paragraph: GENEVA, June 19 -- The Credentials Committee of the International Labor Organization recommended today that the employer and worker members of the countries of the Soviet bloc be seated at the organization's conference now in session here.
docs.abstract: credentials com, 2-1, backs seating USSR employer and labor reprs; issue goes to conf floor; US stand revd

headline.main: I. L. O. UNIT VOTES FOR SOVIET GROUP; Credentials Body Rules, 2-1, to Seat Employer, Worker -- U. S. Opposes Step

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: AS the title suggests, this is a novel partly about a man cast away on a lonely isle. It differs from Defoe's classic, however, in a number of respects. For one thing, the author throws his hero into the arena of empyrean social thinking -- and into...
docs.lead_paragraph: AS the title suggests, this is a novel partly about a man cast away on a lonely isle. It differs from Defoe's classic, however, in a number of respects. For one thing, the author throws his hero into the arena of empyrean social thinking -- and into amorous involvement with a bevy of young women.

headline.main: Master Carpenter in Utopia; CRUSOE WARBURTON. By Victor W. Germains. 250 pp. New York: Coward-McCann. $3.50.

docs.snippet: It was a quiet and uneventful week in the foreign exchanges. Business was light, bringing minor price changes. British sterling remained firm around its upper levels on a normal supply and demand and no official intervention.
docs.lead_paragraph: It was a quiet and uneventful week in the foreign exchanges. Business was light, bringing minor price changes. British sterling remained firm around its upper levels on a normal supply and demand and no official intervention.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; Week Ended June 18, 1954

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, June 20 -- Guatemala is by no means the only Latin-American country in which communism is a cause for concern to the United States, State Department officials said today.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, June 20 -- Guatemala is by no means the only Latin-American country in which communism is a cause for concern to the United States, State Department officials said today.
docs.abstract: State Dept holds Communist menace not ltd to Guatemala; sees Communists trying to infiltrate other countries if they fail there, naming Chile, Argentina, Brazil, Cuba, Mex, Panama, Peru; recent Dept survey on status of Communist party in Latin Amer cited; figures on strength; Dept revs pol-econ-soc situation in Guatemala which favored Communists as typical of other countries

headline.main: LATIN REDS FIND FERTILE GROUND; U. S. Survey Lists Communist Danger Points in South and Central America

headline.main: HUNGARY DEFEATS W. GERMANY BY 8-3; England Downs Switzerland to Reach Quarter-Finals in World Soccer Play

docs.snippet: ZIKHRON YAACOV, Israel. THE twenty-eighth International Society for Contemporary Music Festival came to an end in Zikhron Yaacov, Mount Carmel's idyllic wine village, when delegates and guests met with the musicians and composers of Israel and heard...
docs.lead_paragraph: ZIKHRON YAACOV, Israel. THE twenty-eighth International Society for Contemporary Music Festival came to an end in Zikhron Yaacov, Mount Carmel's idyllic wine village, when delegates and guests met with the musicians and composers of Israel and heard two characteristic concerts: an evening of Israeli folklore and a concert of chamber music of the oriental-minded Israeli composers, Partos, Boscovich and Seter.

headline.main: I. S. C. M. IN ISRAEL; Annual Festival Devoted to New Music With Milhaud's 'David' as Highlight

docs.snippet: SAO PAULO, Brazil, June 26 -- United States prestige with the Latin Americans has suffered a severe blow through the Guatemalan fighting whether the North Americans have any direct responsibility or not.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAO PAULO, Brazil, June 26 -- United States prestige with the Latin Americans has suffered a severe blow through the Guatemalan fighting whether the North Americans have any direct responsibility or not.
docs.abstract: US prestige throughout Latin Amer seen damaged by stand on Guatemala; Brazilian press criticism held typical; centers on US backing of dictatorial regimes

headline.main: U. S. PRESTIGE EBBS IN LATIN AMERICA; Guatemalan Invasion Believed Impossible Without Tacit Washington Approval

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, June 26 -- The successful Communist infiltration of the Government of Guatemala has raised an anxious question in Washington: Is this an isolated case, or are similar things brewing in other parts of Latin America?
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, June 26 -- The successful Communist infiltration of the Government of Guatemala has raised an anxious question in Washington: Is this an isolated case, or are similar things brewing in other parts of Latin America?
docs.abstract: Factors exposing Latin-Amer nations to Communist infiltration listed; cartoon; map; chart

headline.main: GUATEMALA HIGHLIGHTS LATIN-AMERICA'S ILLS; Unstable Economies Provide the Communists With Opportunities
